scalingEndurance IIISwift IIIGuardian IIIPirates(+30% Gold and Gems) How to Get New Units in Anime Saga The units on the banners in Anime Saga rotate every hour. You can get new units in Anime Saga by summoning them on banners that rotate every hour. The units on the banner are on a rate-up. So, you have a better chance of obtaining them than other Mythic and Legendary units. There is also a Mythical and Legendary pity system that guarantees you get a rare unit if you are unlucky. Also, some units, like Remu, are obtainable only through time-limited events. How to Evolve Units in Anime Saga Evolving units can be quite grindy in Anime Saga. You can evolve units in Anime Saga at the Super Mabu NPC in the main lobby. Only specific Mythic units can be evolved, and for each of them, you will have to grind out a bunch of rare materials. Evolved units are much stronger than their regular versions. So, evolving your units should be on your priority list when playing Anime Saga. That does it for our Anime Saga tier list. Now, you know which units to aim for when summoning and grinding for them. If you want to claim some free Gems and start summoning units right away, then make sure to check out our Anime Saga codes. Anime Saga Tier List FAQs What are the best early-game units in Anime Saga?The best units for the early game in Anime Saga are Vogita, Sake, Ichigan, Itaduro, and Tanjigo. What are the best overall units in Anime Saga?The best units overall in Anime Saga are Zid, Remu, Frierin, Chainsaw, Rohan, and Zoru. How long does it take to grind out the materials needed to evolve a unit in Anime Saga?It can take you quite a bit of time to collect all of the materials needed to evolve a single unit in Anime Saga. So, you should focus on grinding the materials required to evolve the best units first. The Escapist is supported by our audience. html:
Image by The Escapist

Frierin is insane for Raids üßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.

|

Published: May 20, 2025 07:04 am

Having strong units is essential if you want to progress in Anime Saga because end-game stages can be extremely challenging. However, with so many units available, it is hard to choose which ones to roll for. To help you grind only for the best units, we prepared the following Anime Saga tier list.

Table of Contents

  • Anime Saga Tier List
    • Tier List of Best Units for Story
    • Tier List of Best Units for Raids
  • List of Anime Saga Units
    • S-Tier Units
    • A-Tier Units
    • B-Tier Units
    • C-Tier Units
    • D-Tier Units
  • How to Get New Units in Anime Saga
  • How to Evolve Units in Anime Saga
  • Anime Saga Tier List FAQs

Anime Saga Tier List

  • S-tier: Zid, Remu, Frierin, Okorun
  • A-tier: Chainsaw, Doma, Rohan, Zoru, Inos
  • B-tier: Mochi, Vogita, Sake, Agony
  • C-tier: Nezu, Sanjo, Ichigan, Itaduro, Tanjigo
  • D-tier: Roku, Usoap, Noroto, Luffo

In the above tier list, we ranked all units in Anime Saga based on how strong they are overall and how well they scale later on. In general, rare units have better stats and thus, better scaling. However, some units stand out from the rest within each rarity tier, like Rohan and Vogita, for example. These are the factors we took into consideration when ranking each unit:

  • Damage, HP, and cooldowns
  • Scaling potential
  • iFrames
  • Crowd control and AoE
  • Support utility
  • End-game usefulness
  • Set Passive bonuses

Since Story stages and Raids differ greatly, here are two tier lists that rank only the best units in Anime Saga for those game modes. For Story stages, we gave priority to units with good AoE size and short cooldowns. For Raids, single-target DPS and burst damage are all that matter, so we ranked them based on those metrics.

Tier List of Best Units for Story

Tier List of Best Units for Raids

List of Anime Saga Units

Below is a list of all units in Anime Saga sorted by their rank on our tier list. We included some pros and cons, as well as best traits, for each unit to give you a better idea of their strengths and why we ranked them the way we did.

S-Tier Units

A-Tier Units

B-Tier Units

C-Tier Units

D-Tier Units

How to Get New Units in Anime Saga

You can get new units in Anime Saga by summoning them on banners that rotate every hour. The units on the banner are on a rate-up. So, you have a better chance of obtaining them than other Mythic and Legendary units. There is also a Mythical and Legendary pity system that guarantees you get a rare unit if you are unlucky. Also, some units, like Remu, are obtainable only through time-limited events.

How to Evolve Units in Anime Saga

You can evolve units in Anime Saga at the Super Mabu NPC in the main lobby. Only specific Mythic units can be evolved, and for each of them, you will have to grind out a bunch of rare materials. Evolved units are much stronger than their regular versions. So, evolving your units should be on your priority list when playing Anime Saga.

That does it for our Anime Saga tier list. Now, you know which units to aim for when summoning and grinding for them. If you want to claim some free Gems and start summoning units right away, then make sure to check out our Anime Saga codes.

Anime Saga Tier List FAQs

What are the best early-game units in Anime Saga?

The best units for the early game in Anime Saga are Vogita, Sake, Ichigan, Itaduro, and Tanjigo.

What are the best overall units in Anime Saga?

The best units overall in Anime Saga are Zid, Remu, Frierin, Chainsaw, Rohan, and Zoru.

How long does it take to grind out the materials needed to evolve a unit in Anime Saga?

It can take you quite a bit of time to collect all of the materials needed to evolve a single unit in Anime Saga. So, you should focus on grinding the materials required to evolve the best units first.
